subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Restricts the number of boolean operators (&&, ||, &, | and ^) in an expression.
subsection.p: Rationale: Too many conditions leads to code that is difficult to read and hence debug and maintain.

Note that the operators & and | are not only integer bitwise operators, they are also the
non-shortcut versions of the boolean operators && and ||.

Note that &, | and ^ are not checked if they are part of constructor or method call because they can be applied to non-boolean variables and Checkstyle does not know types of methods from different classes.

tr.td: Specify the maximum number of boolean operations allowed in one expression.

subset of tokens
LAND , BAND , LOR , BOR , BXOR .
